summary: Julia E. Olson, M.D., an anesthesiologist, had her license summarily suspended after collapsing in an operating room while providing patient care and being found with an IV catheter in her foot. A subsequent Board investigation and her own admission revealed she had diverted and self-administered controlled dangerous substances, including Propofol, Dilaudid, Fentanyl, and Versed. The Maryland State Board of Physicians took emergency action due to the immediate risk to public health and safety.
